title: Coconut Lime Chicken
ingredients: 375 g chicken breast or thigh (about 1 large breast or 2 small, cut into 1‑in pieces)
1 tbsp avocado oil (or olive oil), divided
instructions: Cook the rice.  Prepare jasmine rice according to package instructions.
In a mixing bowl, toss chicken pieces with 1 tbsp avocado oil, ½ tbsp soy sauce, and 1 tbsp cornstarch until evenly coated.
Spread on a parchment-lined baking sheet and bake at 400 °F (200 °C) for about 20 minutes, until golden and slightly crispy. Flip halfway through for even cooking.
While chicken is baking, heat the remaining 1 tbsp oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Sauté diced shallot, minced ginger, and garlic for 1–2 minutes, until fragrant.
Add sliced red bell pepper, onion, and mushrooms.  Cook for 3–5 minutes until they begin to soften.
Pour in coconut milk, ½ tbsp soy sauce, maple syrup, and paprika—stir to combine.
Once chicken is cooked, transfer it into the sauce along with the lime juice. Stir gently to coat.
Serve.  Dish out rice onto plates or bowls, ladle the coconut‑lime chicken over top, and garnish with extra lime wedges and cilantro if desired.
remarks: Adapted from a Recipe from Plantyou.com.
